content.para: The 3.14.0 release upgrades the underlying RCP platform used in the Workbench and provides support for high-DPI devices. A number of smaller improvements have been folded into this release, including embedding snowball stemmers, updating PubMed links to https (as per official recommendation) and adjusting various logs to include more contextual information.

td.p: The Workbench has been upgraded to Eclipse RCP Neon release. This provides support for high-resolution displays, improved stability and support for SWT-AWT bridge, which makes Aduna visualization work again on Macs.
This upgrade requires Java 1.8. This affects Workbench only, the rest of the framework is still on 1.7.
Binary builds of Workbench will be available for 64-bit platforms only, 32-bits can be built from source.
Workbench version for MacOSX has been reshaped to better reflect application structure on that operating system.
Visualizations (Circles and FoamTree) have been updated to the newest stable release.
PubMed switched to HTTPS protocol as of September, 2016. This update adjusts the document source to this change.

content.p: For a complete list of improvements and bug fixes, see JIRA
